channel.title: Stories from insidehook.com - Digg
channel.description: Archive of the best insidehook.com stories on Digg including articles, videos, and photos

item.title: IKEA Released Its Iconic Swedish Meatball Recipe. Here's How To Make Them
item.description: IKEA decided to release its Swedish meatball recipe for home cooks to make during coronavirus quarantine. Here are the ingredients and directions.

item.title: Michael Jordan's Preferred Whiskey Glass Is A Stunner
item.description: These crystal old-fashioned glasses will elevate your whiskey game.
item.kicker: BE LIKE MIKE (IF YOU CAN AFFORD IT)

item.title: What It's Like to Be Followed By A KGB Agent In The 1990s
item.description: John Sipher, former member of the CIA's National Clandestine Service, talks about what it's like to be trailed by a KGB agent in Russia.

item.title: What's It Like To Drive A Toyota Tundra In New York City?
item.description: We spent two weeks driving around NYC in a half-ton Toyota Tundra 4×4, 1794 Crewmax Edition. It was big. Here's what we learned.

item.title: We Asked A Classics Professor How To Train Like A Real-Life Roman Gladiator
item.description: There's no training manual handy. But art has left us some clues.

item.title: How To Make Better Coffee At Home, According To A Coffee Scientist
item.description: You've got the time. Now all you need is the materials and the know-how.

item.title: Last Porsche 991 Being Auctioned Off For COVID-19 Relief
item.description: Porsche and RM Sotheby's are auctioning off the last 991-generation 911 Speedster online to benefit United Way Worldwide's COVID-19 relief fund.

item.title: How Does One Actually Go About Becoming a LEGO Master?
item.description: "LEGO Masters" finalists Boone and Mark explain how they built their legacies.

item.title: Has Coronavirus Exposed A Horniness Gap Between Men And Women?
item.description: As COVID-19 takes up much of our mental energy, men and women are dealing with their sexual urges (or lack thereof) in different ways.

item.title: Which Cars Will Be The Last To Offer A Manual Transmission?
item.description: Manual transmissions still enjoy huge market share overseas, but the numbers are in decline, and the vehicle classes keeping it alive are not what you think.

item.title: A Beginner's Guide To Gordon Ramsay's Sprawling, Tyrannical TV Empire
item.description: The British chef's charming indignation can keep you occupied for at least a couple weeks of quarantine.
item.kicker: BOW DOWN TO THE MASTER CHEF

item.title: Dads Are The Butt Of Every Good TikTok Joke Now
item.description: TikTok has been full of wholesome dad content for quite some time now. Like this dad, who quit beer and snacks and replaced his habits with tons of fruit.

item.title: Quibi's Brave New World Of Reality TV Is A Magnificent Disaster
item.description: We watched all 12 of Quibi's "Unscripted" shows and learned absolutely nothing. Is that the premise?

item.title: Quibi's Brave New World Of Reality TV Is A Magnificent Disaster
item.description: By bringing together some of the biggest celebrity names for off-beat streaming shows, Jeffrey Katzenberg's new ventture is odd and confusing.

item.title: Winery Launches Dog Delivery Service
item.description: A winery in Maryland launched a new curbside dog delivery service, in which a dog named Soda Pup will bring a maximum of two wine bottles to your car.
item.kicker: CAN THEY DELIVER TO ALL 50 STATES

item.title: Is There Any Legitimate Health Advice In Gwyneth Paltrow's 'Goop Lab'?
item.description: We just quarantine-binged Gwyneth Paltrow's six-epidsode docuseries on Netflix, and we have some thoughts.

item.title: Why 'Cheers' Is The Best Show To Stream During COVID-19
item.description: After bars across America closed to stop the spread of COVID-19, more people starting streaming "Cheers" on Netflix for comfort.
item.kicker: SOMETIMES YOU WANNA GO... ANYWHERE, REALLY

item.title: Dr. Harvey Karp, The SNOO And The Quest To Solve Bad Sleep
item.description: A high-tech bassinet has revolutionized the market. Will it ever reach the masses?

item.title: How To Read 'Moby-Dick,' The Perfect Book For Troubled Times
item.description: You don't need a Melville course. Do it two chapters a night, at your desk, with a glass of Scotch in hand.

item.title: Welcome to the Age of Male Fertility Testing
item.description: With global fertility rates in decline, startups like Legacy and Dadi are helping men take a proactive approach to family planning.

item.title: 'Infinity Bottles' Are The Whiskey-Nerd Hobby You Need In Your Life
item.description: It's like blending your own booze. And sometimes it even tastes good.

item.title: Thanks To Bookshop, Indies Stand A Chance Against Amazon
item.description: Bookshop is a new online bookstore helping independent retailers stay afloat during the coronavirus pandemic and fight back against Amazon.

item.title: MTV Is Stuck In Time. How Long Can It Survive?
item.description: Shows like "The Challenge" and "Jersey Shore" have been network staples for well over a decade, begging the question of who, exactly, they're targeting.

item.title: Coronavirus Is Killing More Men Than Women
item.description: Medical officials have some theories why coronavirus is killing more men than women, from habitual (smoking) to hormonal (estrogen).

item.title: The Cheesy, Sexed-Up '8-Minute Abs' Video Still Holds Up, 25 Years Later
item.description: It made $20 million after its 1995 release for very good reason.

item.title: No, Your Beard Is Not Actually Spreading Disease
item.description: If you look into the history of public health, you'll find instances where beards were blamed for the spread of disease. This is not actually true.

item.title: Restaurant Accused Of Selling $2 Frozen Pizzas For $18
item.description: Coquin restaurant in Charleston is facing criticism for allegedly selling $2 frozen pizzas to customers for $18 and passing them off as homemade.

item.title: I Hate The Coronavirus Burger So Much
item.description: The coronavirus burger was invented in an attempt to lighten the mood amid a pandemic, but instead I've found joy in hating it.

item.title: A Swiss Hotel's Luxury Quarantine Package Includes A $500 COVID-19 Test
item.description: High-end Swiss hotel Le Bijou is offering a luxury coronavirus package featuring round-the-clock medical care and a $500 coronavirus test.

item.title: How I Learned To Stop Worrying And Love The Mercedes G-Wagen
item.description: I never loved the Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG before. But driving the ludicrously-speedy utility vehicle around Scotland changed my mind.
item.kicker: NOT A CAR IN THE WORLD

item.title: When A Community Becomes A Cult
item.description: A new book documents harrowing life within the Word of Faith Fellowship, a cult in North Carolina.
item.kicker: WE'LL TAKE THEIR WORD FOR IT

item.title: Revisiting The Infamous, Twisted, Now-Defunct Presidential Fitness Test
item.description: Are you stronger than a fifth grader?

item.title: How Pro Athletes Are Staying In Shape At Home During Coronavirus
item.description: We scoped out what some fitness pros and athletes were up to on social media and beyond to stay in shape during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Eight Ways You Can Help Others During The Coronavirus Crisis
item.description: Most of which you can do from your couch. In pajamas.

item.title: Training To Live On The Moon And Mars In Hawaii
item.description: Hawaii's Mauna Loa lava fields, resembling lunar or martian surfaces, is home to EuroMoonMars IMA HI-Seas training.

item.title: Nick Butter Ran 196 Marathons In 22 Months. Here's What He Learned
item.description: On January 6th, 2018, he took the first steps of a marathon in Toronto. Six hundred and seventy-five days later, he crossed the finish line of a different marathon in Greece. In between? 194 other marathons.

item.title: The Celebrity Coronavirus Content Is Becoming Increasingly Deranged
item.description: Even the rich and famous are getting stir-crazy.

item.title: We Flew To Italy. Then Came The Coronavirus Lockdowns
item.description: The story of two American men who flew to Italy for a long-awaited Euro road trip, then faced coronavirus lockdowns and "the amazing race out of Europe."

item.title: Everything You Need To Know About New York's New To-Go Booze Laws
item.description: Desperate times call for creative drink measures.

item.title: Get To Know The Iditarod, America's Last Remaining Spectator Sport
item.description: With every other live sport off the air, the Iditarod might be the last man standing: the annual long-distance sled dog race that follows highly skilled mushers and their furry running mates in a 15-day dash across Alaska.

item.title: What To Do With All The Rarely Used Bottles In Your Home Bar
item.description: From Drambuie to Jaegermesiter, there are certain bottles of liquor that everyone owns but no one uses. Here's what to do with them.
item.kicker: TIME TO EXPLORE THE BACK OF THE PANTRY

item.title: It's Time To Rediscover The Lost Art Of Phone Sex
item.description: As self-quarantine forces many separated partners to replace sex with remote sex, you might want to consider adding old-school phone sex into the mix.

item.title: Welcome To The Era Of The Five-Hour, $5,000 'Super Physical' Exam
item.description: Manhattan's Elitra Health Center offers the most thorough one-day exam in the country, and immediate results.

item.title: The Perfect Ken Burns Binge-Watch Plan
item.description: If you have to be stuck inside looking for somthing to watch, why not spend a week watching Ken Burns docs in chronological order?

item.title: Real Talk: If You Leisure Travel During Coronavirus, You Are Not A Good Person
item.description: If you have even a modicum of decency in you, you should cancel all your imminent travel plans immediately.

item.title: How Casey Currie Became The First American To Win The Dakar Rally
item.description: No matter where it was held over the last four decades, an American driver was never able to meet the Dakar Rally's challenge before Casey Currie.

item.title: The Unintentional Hilarity Of LinkedIn's Positive-Vibe Warriors
item.description: The one social media platform we can't afford to delete is on a back-patting bender.

item.title: Ford Plans To Replace Sedans With Smaller Pickups
item.description: According to Automotive News, Ford is planning a new smaller pickup that will replace discontinued sedans. Some dealers have already seen the new truck.

item.title: College Students Unknowingly Pay Thousands To Support Athletics
item.description: An NBC investigation found students pay hidden fees that don't always appear on tuition bills.

item.title: The Eight Best Airbnbs Near — And Inside — National Parks
item.description: This option to stay near or in these parks (yes, inside the park) has become increasingly common due in large part to Airbnb, where many rentals can be found right there among the nature and wildlife.
